description: Telford and Wrekin Council wants the government to put pressure on the Environment Agency.
title: Council to push for closure of Granville Landfill site
title_page: Council to push for closure of Granville Landfill site - BBC News
maintext:
A council has said it will push to have a landfill site closed down, because of complaints about smells.
People living near the Granville site in Telford, Shropshire, have said there is a "vile eggy odour" coming from it.
At a meeting on Thursday, members of Telford and Wrekin Council agreed to write to the government to ask the Environment Agency to "issue a closure notice".
The operator, Potters (Midlands) Ltd, has been approached by the BBC, but has yet to respond.
The Environment Agency has previously said it was working with the firm to resolve these issues.
The landfill site closed as a household recycling centre in 2016, but is licensed to operate privately until 2030.
People nearby have complained of having to keep their windows closed to keep the smell out, and that it gets worse in the summer.
A motion was put forward by the Conservative councillor for Priorslee, Rachael Tyrrell, calling for the site to be closed down sooner than 2030.
She said it was an important issue, adding that residents had "suffered terribly".
